snippet: Twenty-nine statues in London and Manchester have recently been given a voice in “Talking Statues,” a public art project by the nonprofit Sing London.
abstract: Talking Statues, public art project initiated by nonprofit arts organization Sing London, gives voice to 29 statues of famous figures throughout London and Manchester, England; visitors swipe smartphone across bar code or chip that sets off call to phone and playing of audio file that delivers monologue from represented character.
lead_paragraph: Twenty-nine statues in London and Manchester have recently been given a voice in “Talking Statues,” a public art project by the nonprofit Sing London.

headline.seo: In ‘Talking Statues,’ Sing London Gives Artwork a Voice
headline.main: They’re a Bit Stiff, but Very Talkative
headline.print_headline: They’re a Bit Stiff, but Very Talkative
